data.title: When will rosters update?
data.meta_description: With todayÂ’s MyTEAM pack update, I see that Shannon Brown is back. Really 2K needs to get it together and release all the assets in myTEAM for offline
data.text:
MVP

OVR: 10

Join Date: Jan 2005

Location: GA

Re: When will rosters update?

I've been asking for the same since 2K20 as that was the last game to feature an IN-Season roster update to the classic teams as there wasn't one single update to classic and all-time teams last season, likely due to office personnel working from home, etc

Here's who I've found in MYTEAM that could/should be added to offline areas in 2K22

MISSING CLASSIC TEAM PLAYERS

Players to add to Classic Teams that are in MYTEAM

- Yuta Tabuse - 2004-2005 Phoenix Suns

- Jarvis Hayes - 2006-2007 Washington Wizards

- Tyson Chandler - 2010-2011 Dallas Mavericks, 2011-2012 New York Knicks

- Kyle Korver - 2010-2011 Chicago Bulls

- Jeremy Lin - 2011-2012 New York Knicks, 2018-2019 Toronto Raptors

- Jamal Crawford - 2013-2014 Los Angeles Clippers

- Patrick McCaw - 2016-2017 Golden State Warriors

- Shaun Livingston - 2015-2016 Golden State Warriors, 2016-2017 Golden State Warriors

NBA HISTORIC COACH UPDATES

Coaches to add to rosters that are in MYTEAM 2K22

- Phil Jackson - 90/91 Bulls. 92/93 Bulls, 95/96 Bulls, 97/98 Bulls, 00-01 Lakers, 03/04 Lakers

OFFICIAL HISTORIC DRAFT CLASSES:

Players to add to each Historic Draft Class who are currently included officially in MYTEAM but who are not available in their respective draft class.

- Tom Van Arsdale - 1965 NBA Draft

- Jerry Sloan - 1965 NBA Draft

- Robert Reid - 1977 NBA Draft

- Cedric Maxwell - 1977 NBA Draft

MVP

OVR: 21

Join Date: Nov 2011

Location: California

Re: When will rosters update?

Pjt can atest to this, but I like him have for years been advocating for there to be someone within the 2K employee ranks whose main job responsibility is to make sure each team roster is accurate with current players and free agency is accurate with current free agents. I am however split down the middle when it comes to this recent 10-day hardship contracts being as that nobody could've predicted this happening and isn't one of the biggest reasons why most of us play 2K every single year is the MyNBA mode that allows us to create something of our own and let it grow into something bigger. I will admit that I myself have at least 5 MyNBA separate files (1 being my template file, 1 being a mirrored reflection of the current NBA sesaon, 1 being a file that I control all 30 teams and only play with my Lakers and only the Laker game outcomes could possibly be different than reality, every other game played by all 29 other teams the "forced to win" option is used to mirror the reality result and the 2 other 2 files are just to sim and see what goes on in later years), but just the simple fact that we are unable to have more than 20 players on a teams roster maybe we don't to mirror the current NBA season as spot on as we are trying to. If I'm not mistaken most of these 10 day hardships contracts have already expired and players were not re-signed or those players that signed those hardship deals some had to be placed in the safety protocols and were unable to even suit up during their 10 day contract right?

In any case 2K making the effort to add these players I think deserves a pat on the back from all of us because they really don't have to do it, but I say that after paying $70 for a video game I kinda want my $70 to be spent well so i applaud them for making the effort but again for $70 I would expect those players to be added to get my $$ worth in the end.

pjt8405 likes this.
